p: Laboratory diagnosis of ZIKV infections mostly relies on molecular biology and serology.[ 53 72] Viral RNA isolation from clinical samples (blood, urine) forms the confirmatory laboratory diagnosis for ZIKV. Viral RNA may be demonstrated from blood samples up to 1â€“5 days after the onset of symptoms.[ 73 74] The diagnosis should not be excluded even in cases of negative results because the RT-PCR has a sensitivity of 40%.
